response: If there was one word that could act as a standard of conduct for one's entire life, perhaps it would be 'thoughtfulness.
The demands that good people make are upon themselves;Those that bad people make are upon others.
What the superior man seeks is in himself; what the small man seeks is in others.
When the archer misses the center of the target, he turns around and seeks for the cause of his failure in himself.
To lead an uninstructed people to war is to throw them away.
Virtuous, they are free from anxieties; wise they are free from perplexities; and bold they are free from fear.
Only the wisest and stupidest of men never change.
The gentleman does not violate ren even for the amount of time required to eat a meal.
A true gentleman is one who has set his heart upon the Way. A fellow who is ashamed merely of shabby clothing or modest meals is not even worth conversing with.
In a country badly governed, wealth is something to be ashamed of.
Wealth and honor are things that all people desire, and yet unless they are acquired in the proper way, I will not abide them.
Virtue is not left to stand alone. He who practices it will have neighbors.
To practice five things under all circumstances constitutes perfect virtue; these five are gravity, generosity of soul, sincerity, earnestness, and kindness.
The gentleman understands what is moral. The small man understands what is profitable.
Faced with what is right, to leave it undone shows a lack of courage.
Never contract friendship with a man that is not better than thyself.
Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
If we don't know life, how can we know death?
The expectations of life depend upon diligence.
Three things cannot long be hidden: the sun, the moon, and the truth.
Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.
Fine words and an insinuating appearance are seldom associated with true virtue.
One who never anticipates deceit or expects duplicity, and yet is the first to recognize such things – is that not a sage indeed?
Without knowing the force of words, it is impossible to know men
It is only the truly virtuous man who can love, or who can hate, others
When we see persons of worth, we should think of equaling them; when we see persons of a contrary character, we should turn inwards and examine ourselves.
It is easy to hate, and it is difficult to love.
When anger rises, think of the consequences.
To be wronged is nothing unless you continue to remember it.
Forget injuries, never forget kindnesses.
If you make a mistake and do not correct it, this is called a mistake.
A true teacher is one who, keeping the past alive, is also able to understand the present.
If I am walking with two other men, each of them will serve as my teacher.
Learn as if you were not reaching your goal and as though you were scared of missing it
He who learns but does not think is lost! He who thinks but does not learn is in great danger.

To one who is not eager I do not reveal anything, nor do I explain anything to one who is not communicative. If I raise one corner for someone and he cannot come back with the other three, I do not go on.
To know what you know and what you do not know, that is true knowledge.
I used to take on trust a man's deeds after having listened to his words. Now having listened to a man's words I go on to observe his deeds.
To see the right and not to do it is cowardice.

When a person should be spoken with, and you don't speak with them, you lose them. When a person shouldn't be spoken with and you speak to them, you waste your breath. The wise do not lose people, nor do they waste their breath.
Do not impose on others what you yourself do not desire.
To rule a country of a thousand chariots, there must be reverent attention to business, and sincerity; economy in expenditure, and love for men;
He who exercises government by means of his virtue may be compared to the north polar star, which keeps its place and all the stars turn towards it.
Lead them with excellence and put them in their place through roles and ritual practices, and in addition to developing a sense of shame, they will order themselves harmoniously
All good things are difficult to achieve; and bad things are very easy to get.
This is not a misfortune to be misunderstood men, but it is a misfortune to ignore.
Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
The parents' age must be remembered, both for joy and anxiety.
Give a bowl of rice to a man and you will feed him for a day. Teach him how to grow his own rice and you will save his life.
Don’t worry if you have no position: worry about making yourself worthy of one.
Better light a candle than curse the darkness.
Fine words and an insinuating appearance are seldom associated with true virtue.
To be truly happy and contented, you must let go of what it means to be happy or content.
What you do not want done to yourself, do not do to others.
He who conquers himself is the mightiest warrior.
The gem cannot be polished without friction, nor man perfected without trials.
To rank the effort above the prize may be called love.
By nature, men are nearly alike; by practice, they get to be wide apart.
The firm, the enduring, the simple, and the modest are near to virtue.
I have seen men die from treading on water and fire, but I have never seen a man die from treading the course of virtue.
When it is obvious that the goals cannot be reached, don't adjust the goals, adjust the action steps.
It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
If you expect great things of yourself and demand little of others, you’ll keep resentment far away.
If a man reaches the age of forty or fifty and has not made himself heard of, then indeed he will not be worth being regarded with respect.
The nobler sort of man emphasizes the good qualities in others and does not accentuate the bad.
Worry not that no one knows you; seek to be worth knowing.
Behave toward everyone as if receiving a great guest.
What you do not want done to yourself, do not do to others.
To be poor without murmuring is difficult. To be rich without being proud is easy.
In a country well governed, poverty is something to be ashamed of.
Our greatest glory is in not falling, but in rising every time we fall.
The superior man has dignified ease without pride.
To see and listen to the wicked is already the beginning of wickedness.
Before you embark on a journey of revenge, dig two graves.
Knowing something is not as good as liking it. Liking something is not as good as rejoicing in it.
Never go back to a place where you have been happy.
I will pick out the good points of the one and imitate them, and the bad points of the other and correct them in myself.
Never contract friendship with a man that is not better than thyself.
By three methods we may learn wisdom: First, by reflection, which is noblest; Second, by imitation, which is easiest; and third by experience, which is the bitterest.
I am not one who was born in the possession of knowledge; I am one who is fond of antiquity and earnest in seeking it there.
The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
The superior man acts before he speaks, and afterwards speaks according to his action.
The journey with 1000 miles begins with one step.
I hear and I forget. I see and I remember. I do and I understand.
Lead the people with administrative injunctions and put them in their place with penal law, and they will avoid punishments but will be without a sense of shame.
Signs and symbols rule the world, not words nor laws.
An oppressive government is more to be feared than a tiger.
The hardest thing of all is to find a black cat in a dark room, especially if there is no cat.
Silence is a true friend who never betrays.
The superior man is modest in his speech, but exceeds in his actions.
Where words lose their meaning, people lose their freedom.
